ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Then, when He wills, He raises him from the dead.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Then He will raise him up again when He please.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and then, whenever He wishes, He will raise him back to life.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and He will resurrect him whenever He wants.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Then, when He willed, He brought him out. (As during the night of Holy Prophet’s ascension, when all the Prophets gathered behind him in the Al Aqsa mosque in Jerusalem. Or when Allah will raise everyone on the Day of Resurrection.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then when it is His will, He will resurrect him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then when He pleases, He will raise him to life again.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: then, when He wills, He raises him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then, when He will, He bringeth him again to life.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Then when He pleases, He will bring him back to life.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then when He listeth, He shall raise him to life.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and then, when He wished, resurrected him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then, when it is His Will, He will raise him up (again).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then, when it is His Will, He will resurrect him (again).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: then, He will raise him when He wills.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Then, when He wills, He will resurrect him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then when He wills, He will resurrect him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [80:22] then, when He wills, He will raise him, for the Resurrection.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then, when He will, He bringeth him again to life) i.e. He will resurrect him from the grave.
